body_html:
Thanks for the PR, but I think this change is not right.

self is the destination tensor, while src is the input tensor that should be indexed.
We want to assert that the source (input) tensor has at least 2 dimensions so that we can select one of it's dimensions. If src has only one dimension, the result of selecting is a number and not a tensor, and thus not handled by this function.

Also, this change would make TH select inconsistent with THC select, as their code are exactly the same now.

Let me know what you think.

body:
Thanks for the PR, but I think this change is not right.

`self` is the destination tensor, while `src` is the input tensor that should be indexed.
We want to assert that the source (input) tensor has at least 2 dimensions so that we can select one of it's dimensions. If `src` has only one dimension, the result of selecting is a number and not a tensor, and thus not handled by this function.

Also, this change would make [TH `select` inconsistent with THC `select`](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensor.c#L456-L458), as their code are exactly the same now.

Let me know what you think.
